The game features a variety of once-human monsters and interdimensional bosses for players to fight. It offers players customization in the form of approximately 100 gun blueprints divided into seven categories. Players can build their own homes, designing them to their specifications. And, of course, as they play, they’ll discover the truth of Stardust.

Title: Stormgate
short_description: A free-to-play science fantasy real-time strategy game in which humans and robots defend Earth from alien forces.
Description:
Stormgate is a free-to-play science fantasy real-time strategy game in which humans and robots defend Earth from alien forces. Developed and published by Frost Giant Studios – a studio made up of former members of Blizzard’s defunct RTS team – pits Earth against demonic invaders and their angelic opponents.

The game features three different modes: co-op, ranked, and a 3v3 mode with a no-elimination policy. The game’s story-driven campaign puts players in the role of heroes fighting to determine the fate of the world. The Vanguard prologue chapter is available for free, while other chapters will be available for purchase.

It’s built on Unreal Engine 5 and uses Frost Giant’s proprietary “SnowPlay” technology. The combined offer players a responsive experience.

Title: Fractured Online
short_description: A free-to-play open-world sandbox MMORPG from developer and publisher Dynamight Studios
Description:
Fractured Online is a free-to-play open-world sandbox MMORPG from developer and publisher Dynamight Studios. It features a robust talent and knowledge system that allows players to learn and master skills quickly, allowing them to get moving in the game early on. Players can choose how they want to interact with the world, exploring, fighting monsters, fighting other players in PvP, gathering resources, and even setting up their own trade empire among other things.

The game is designed to appeal to both competitive and cooperative players and features three different worlds that are constantly changing as player help shape them. Everything from roaming monsters to growing settlements change how a player will experience an area from one day to the next.

Players can build their own home in one of the game’s player-run cities or even start a new settlement with their guild. As the cities are player-built and driven they will vary greatly.

For those looking for something more competitive, the game also features end-game PvP events. Fight to raise the influence of your guild and bring home items to advance its settlement.
Processor: Intel Core i3 (2nd gen) or equivalent AMD
Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 750 or equivalent ATI Radeon

Title: Battle Crush
short_description: An action brawler for up to 30 players.
Description:
Up to 30 players come together in NCSoft’s action brawler Battle Crush to compete in eight-minute rounds and find out who will be the last one standing – a feat made even more difficult by the fact that the ground can fall out from beneath the players’ feet. The game allows players to combine seven skills in order to fit their playstyle.

The game casts people as “Calixers”, Battle Crush’s version of Heroes. Each is inspired by mythical figures such as Poseidon, Hades, and Hermes and has their own story and skill sets.

Battle Crush offers several game modes for solo players and groups. These include Battle Royale (Solo or Team), Brawl (Solo or Team), and Duel. The Battle Royale mode is built for up to 30 players and takes place in a collapsible arena. Players must survive each other and the environment to make it to the end.

In the Brawl Mode, players can team up in groups of three to fight in a smaller arena. Finally, Duel is a best 3-of-5 mode in which players compete one-on-one. Players choose more than one Calixer to play as and when one player loses a round they are allowed to choose an extra item to use in the next.

Title: Screenplay CCG
short_description: A collectible card game inspired by movie making.
Description:
Movie making becomes a whole different kind of competitive in Comico Games’ ScreenPlay CCG. The characters. The tropes. The themes. They’re all there. Imagine if the characters from movies created their own movies, and had an unlimited budget to do it with.

Unlike most CCGs that have players taking turns – as you normally would in a card game – ScreenPlay CCG uses simultaneous turns. The game has both players laying out their turns at the same time as they both create a cinematic piece of their own. Players must choose the cards to play and what they want their characters to do – dodge, attack, or act out performances.

Players pick a combination of three lead characters and build a 40-card deck around them. As they play, they gain Narrative Points to advance their characters’ story arcs. The player to complete two story arcs first is the one to win.

Cards are available via booster packs, playing the game’s missions and the crafting system. Players can use up unwanted duplicates in the crafting system to get the cards they really want.

Title: SolForge Fusion
short_description: A card-battling game in which each card levels up and becomes more powerful.
Description:
Designed by Richard Garfield of Magic: The Gathering and Justin Gary of Ascension Deckbuilding Game, SolForge Fusion is a card-battling game in which each card levels up and becomes more powerful. The game features a unique deck mechanic where every playable deck is crafted from two algorithmically-generated faction decks.

SolForge Fusion’s deck system allows players to create unique decks and therefore a unique experience each time they play. The game offers three modes: PvP, solo, and campaign. Compete against other players or explore the frozen world of Silis and earn rewards and experience.

To make each match even more unique, the game offers cosmetics and power-ups. The devs also promise regular releases of new cards for players to enhance their decks with.
Processor: Dual core from Intel or AMD at 2.8 GHz

Title: Sky: Children of the Light
short_description: A cozy free-to-play MMORPG from thatgamecompany.
Description:
When it comes to games that will make you feel warm and fuzzy, the offerings of thatgamecompany are at the top of the list. The developer of Flower, Flow, and Journey works hard to give players relaxing and comforting games, whether they be single or multiplayer. Sky: Children of the Light is no different. The MMORPG is a social adventure game that takes place throughout seven realms, with players taking on the role of a child using the light within them to heal the world.

Throughout the game, players meet the spirits of their ancestors who are stuck in the world. Using their light, players can free them and send them home to the stars. To do this players explore an open world – flying, swimming, and gliding. They can go it alone, or team up with friends to go on quests, solve puzzles, and more.

Unlike most MMOs, Sky: Children of the Light doesn’t use a regular chat system but encourages players to interact via emotes. Grab a friend’s hand and take them with you.
Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 1030 or AMD Radeon RX 560

Title: Predecessor
short_description: A free-to-play MOBA shooter developed and published by Omeda Studios.
Description:
Inspired By Paragon, Predecessor is a free-to-play MOBA shooter built on Unreal Engine 5. The free-to-play game features over 30 Heroes, each with unique abilities. One can shoot through walls while another turns into a raven to navigate the battlefield. No one is safe.

While a shooter, Predecessor plays like a standard three-lane MOBA. Players push the objective, take down towers, and work to control their lanes. Earn gold and XP and use it to customize your playstyle.

The game is welcoming to players both experienced in and new to the MOBA genre. Players can choose to take on standard roles like Jungler or do something a little more personalized, playing as a gunslinger or even a knight.
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 1030 2GB or AMD Radeon RX 550 equivalent

Title: Project Apidom
short_description: A free-to-play apocalyptic extraction RPG with MOBA-like combat.
Description:
Fight to make it out alive in Breach.gg and RedTigerPro’s apocalyptic extraction RPG, Project Apidom. Set in the future, the game drops players onto the world of Pangea, where they will team up with friends to fight both monsters and other players.

Pangea was once filled with scientists, but they now reside in the Breach where they create robots to contain their consciousness designed to fight the monsters that forced them to flee in the first place. The robots are fast but not equipped for a fight going in. Players will need to gather resources and craft items in order to fix that. Craft weapons and armor to unlock abilities and enhance the Apidom. As there are no pre-determined roles in the game, this is how players will dictate what their role is. Just be sure to keep an eye out for the enemies if you want to make it out alive.

Project Apidom is free-to-play and can be downloaded via Steam or the Epic Games Store.
Processor: Intel® Core i5-2500K or AMD Ryzen 3 1200

Title: Ravendawn
short_description: A 2D top-down MMORPG featuring homesteading and building mechanics.
Description:
Ravendawn is a 2D top-down MMORPG featuring homesteading and building mechanics. The game is designed to allow players to build anywhere and almost anything. Players claim a plot of land and gather resources in order to establish territory and build their homes.

The game boasts three primary archetypes that can be further refined by unlocking classes and skills. The base archetypes are Dark Knight, Bard, and Loremaster. Each has three skill trees to pull from, allowing players to create a class all their own.

As a game built around building your own place in the world, Ravendawn has a player-driven economy built around fishing, crafting, gathering, and more. Players can build out trade routes and shipping.

Players building their own homes and towns also means that the world will change with them and things will vary as time goes on.

Title: Kritika: Zero
short_description: A free-to-play hack-and-slash MMORPG with both a single-player adventure combat from Valofe.
Description:
Kritika: Zero (Kritika Online) is a free-to-play hack-and-slash MMORPG with both a single-player adventure combat from Valofe.

Players can choose from four different classes: Gunmage, Warrior, Reaper, and Rogue. Each of these has two to three variations designed to make each player’s character even more unique.

The game also boasts special areas known as Danger Zones which allow for quick play sessions without the need of excessive in game travel. Each has a massive boss for players to defeat.

Title: One Punch Man: World
short_description: A free-to-play multiplayer 3D action game from Crunchyroll Games.
Description:
One Punch Man: World is a free-to-play multiplayer 3D action game from Crunchyroll Games. Players take on the role of characters from the popular anime including Saitama, Mumen, Silverfand, Rider, and Genos, and fight against some well-known villains.

Each character boasts their own fighting style and unique set of abilities, just like in the anime. In keeping with that, players can expect cinematic finishing moves. Challenge monsters with a friend via the Hero Association HQ hub. It’s more fun than doing it alone.

The game also offers players plenty of story to get invested in even allowing a peek at the characters’ daily lives, including more mundane things like shopping at the market.

Available on Android, iOS, and PC, One Punch Man: World also features cross-play and progression.

Title: Battle Teams 2
short_description: A multiplayer tactical shooter with an Eastern aesthetic.
Description:
Battle Teams 2 is a multiplayer tactical shooter set in an Eastern environment. Developed and published by Wizard Games Global, the game features a selection of PvP modes as well as narrative-driven co-op PvE in which players fight waves of enemies with their friends.

The game includes well-known modes such as Battle Royale and Team Deathmatch as well as more innovative ones like Big Head Hearo and Infected. Players will discover a wide selection of customizable weapons as they play, allowing them to create their own playstyle and build loadouts.

Battle Teams 2 is optimized for PC with five graphics settings ranging from very low to very high. This allows access to more players no matter their current setup.

Title: The Finals
short_description: A game-show style PvP shooter from Embark Studios.
Description:
The Finals is a free-to-play game-show style PvP shooter from developer and publisher Embark Studios. When playing The Finals, players take on the role of a contestant fighting alongside teams in arenas based on real-world locations. But they won’t just be shooting. The arenas are alterable and players can take advantage of that. Even if it’s just destroying something.

Players can use a variety of weapons ranging from a blade to the environment itself in combat. As anyone can alter the environment, players will need to be prepared and adjust accordingly. Along the way, players will gather fans and fame and craft a unique avatar with the game’s customization options. It’s all about making a name for yourself.
Processor: Intel Core i5-6600K or AMD Ryzen R5 1600
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti or AMD Radeon RX 580

Title: Infinite Borders
short_description: A free-to-play strategy game from NetEase set during China’s Three Kingdoms period.
Description:
Infinite Borders is a free-to-play strategy game set during China’s Three Kingdoms period. Originally a popular mobile game in East Asia, the game is now available on PC via Steam.

Players take on the role of a lord and fight alongside more than 300 well-known heroes from the Three Kingdoms era. These include Liu Bei, Cao Cao, Lv Bu, and others. Players can form teams with a wide selection of generals, building their army to conquer – and keep – lands. Once lands are obtained, players can build cities, and create policies intended to make them even greater.

To build their empire, players must construct and upgrade buildings and facilities and obtain resources and soldiers. The game allows for multiple playstyles, meaning there’s something for the hardcore fighter, the farmer, or the diplomat. Players can even take up spying if they want.

Title: Destiny's Divide
short_description: Free-to-play PvP Fantasy Card Game for competitive card game players.
Description:
Collectible card games get a hardcore PvP twist in Fobia’s Destiny’s Divide. Players choose between eleven heroes and compete against each other in matches with open rules. This means heroes and energy aren’t locked to specific cards. Players can create any kind of deck they want as every card can be played by all heroes. Players can benefit from playing cards of the same type as the hero, however, as doing so costs one less. Interestingly, players can even attack their own cards or hero.

The game uses a shared board in which each player chooses three cards. Of the six total, four will be placed on the shared board for both players to use, while the other two are banned from play. Another unique feature is energy augments. This allows players to select an augment during the deck-building process that will change how they play. Gameplay is further diversified with three types of auras, each serving a different function. To make the game feel more like physical CCGs, Destiny’s Divide allows players to swap or lend cards. There is a system in place to prevent players from abusing this feature.

Destiny’s Divide features four modes: Casual, Constructed, Brawl, and Hardcore. Casual allows players to compete against each other or AI in relaxed sessions. Constructed features the game’s ELO ranking system. In Brawl, players build decks on the fly. In Hard Core, players compete for a chance to win their opponents’ cards. They just need to be careful to not lose their own, because it’s permanent.
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 | AMD Radeon R7 265

Title: Warhammer 40,000: Warpforge
short_description: A free-to-play CCG set in the Warhammer 40K universe.
Description:
Warhammer 40,000: Warpforge is a free-to-play CCG from the makers of The Horus Heresy: Legions. 

Set in the Warhammer 40K universe, the game features all the major 40K factions, including Imperium, Chaos, and the Xenos races. Each faction has their own style and tactics.

Players can explore the game in single-player campaigns. They can also choose to test themselves against other ins draft and constructive competitive modes. These are available as both regular play options and limited-time matches with unique rules. Another option available to players is alliance wars. These are bigger modes that requires players to work with allies. Alliance wars are intended for more experienced players.
Processor: CPU with SSE2 instruction set support

Title: Microvolts: Recharged
short_description: A lobby-based third-person shooter with a toy-theme.
Description:
Microvolts: Recharged is a free-to-play lobby-based third-person shooter developed and published by Masangsoft. The game features several toy-themed arenas. The arenas range from a small town to a back yard requiring players to climb tables and maneuver around tea cups.

Players can choose from a range of anime-style characters but aren’t limited to a specific weapon for each. Instead, players will be able to swap between seven different weapon types. These include melee, rifle, shotgun, sniper, Gatling, bazooka, and grenade.

The game also allows players to customize their characters using a combination of ten costume parts. Players can collect mission costumes by unlocking achievements and completing missions.
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 / AMD Radeon R7 370

Title: Deceit 2
short_description: A social deduction game from World Makers.
Description:
The Deceit franchise continues with Deceit 2. The social deduction horror game from World Makers casts players in various roles, some of which must be rooted out if the others want to survive.

Unlike a lot of social deduction games, Deceit 2 has four roles in the game. The Innocents are exactly what they sound like. Their goal is to avoid death at the hands of others while completing tasks that will help them find an escape key. The next role is the Infected. These individuals can transform and will execute the Innocent given the chance. To do this effectively, they’ll need to earn the trust of the team and wait for the opportune moment.

Another faction is the Cursed. They will work to sow chaos while deceiving Innocents and Infected alike. Finally, there’s the Master. Players will need to climb through the ranks to become a Master, unlocking new items that can help them escape while unleashing new Mutations to give them an edge.
Processor: Intel Core i7-8700 (3.2Ghz) or AMD Ryzen 5 3600 (3.6 Ghz)
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 3060 or AMD Radeon RX 5700 XT or INTEL Arc A770

Title: Hawked
short_description: A free-to-play PvPvE treasure hunting shooter.
Description:
Hawked is a free-to-play extraction shooter set on a mysterious island known as X-Isle. The island is covered in monsters in search of relics from a lost civilization. Players take on the role of treasure-hunting mercenaries known as Renegades and explore and fight the monsters while solving puzzles and – hopefully – making it off the island with the loot.

Players have been recruited by a guild known as GRAIL to retrieve the treasure from the islands. They’ll be able to team up with friends and explore together, fighting other players as they do so. While searching for treasure, players can obtain supplies, gather new weapons and ammo, upgrade gear, and find special abilities and tech to use.

While the game is definitely competitive, it’s not all combat. In fact, there’s a lot for players to experience between puzzle solving, traps, and actual treasure hunting.
Processor: Intel Core i5-6600 (3.3Ghz) or AMD Ryzen 5 1400 (3.2Ghz)
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 4GB or AMD Radeon RX 470 4GB

Title: Tales Of Yore
short_description: A 2D MMORPG with lots of RPG tropes.
Description:
Tales of Yore is a 2D MMORPG with all the things you’d expect from the RPG genre. Discover a new world filled with adventure. Choose your own path – out of hundreds, and earn plenty of rewards. The game features pets, housing, and – of course – lots of shiny gear.

Players can choose from a variety of weapons. Carrots are even an option if that’s your thing. Whatever they choose, players will find themselves going up against everything from rats to giants, making use of over 20 combat abilities to do it with.

If casting is more their thing, players can learn over 30 spells. Some are more utilitarian – like a light spell – while others will help players defend themselves and defeat their enemies. In order to learn these spells, players will have to travel the world, looking for those knowledgeable enough to teach them. They’ll also have to be willing to make concessions when it comes to gear.

Of course, no RPG would be complete without crafting, farming, and collecting things that you probably don’t need but have to anyway because your inner pack rat won’t be happy otherwise. The game offers players more than 50 crafting recipes and plenty of nodes to gather materials from.

Title: Waven
short_description: A free-to-play online tactical RPG from Ankama.
Description:
Waven is a free-to-play co-op game from Wakfu developer Ankama. The game puts players in the role of a seafaring adventurer in a world made of of a few islands that survived a massive flood. Players explore a world that is still home to magic, but seems to have been abandoned by the gods and dragons that once resided there.

Players choose their hero, equip their spells and set out into the world. They’ll move between islands, fighting creatures and increasing their power. Fight in turn-based combat with friends or alone. Challenge yourself in PvP or PvE.

Wave is a cross-platform game. This means players can hop from one device to another.
Graphics: DirectX 10 with at least 2GB of VRAM

Title: Town of Salem 2
short_description: A deduction game set in Salem.
Description:
Town of Salem 2 is a free-to-play deception and deduction game set in the town of Salem. Up to fifteen players take on the role of villagers. Each villager has unique abilities to use in the game, whether to confirm their innocence or track down killers. Some players will take on the role of one of three factions: Coven, Neutral, and Apocalypse, and work to stop the town from solving the murders and cleaning up their town.

The game offers custom lobbies so that players may compete with friends. An unusual feature of the game is that players can personalize a lot of things, not just their characters, but also their pets and their house’s interior. Players can also freely move around the game in lobbies, at night, or as a ghost, to fully explore the game world.

When putting together a match, players have control over the kinds of roles that are allowed, as well as game modifiers. In addition, players who have scrolls can boost their chances of getting the role they want. Provided it hasn’t been banned.
Graphics: DX10, DX11, DX12 capable GPUs 2gb+ VRAM

Title: Naraka: Bladepoint
short_description: A free-to-play melee focused battle royale.
Description:
Naraka Bladepoint is a free-to-play battle royale game developed by 24 Entertainment. The game differs from other battle royale games in that it features dynamic melee-focused combat in which players will need to execute combos and parry attacks. Players are able to traverse the map in unique ways that include wall running, swooping down from above, or zipping around using a grappling hook.

The game features 16 playable characters. It also boasts a selection of 17 weapons, both ranged and melee. Players can play solo or in trios and compete in matches with up to 59 other players. As with other battle royales, Naraka: Bladepoint features a shrinking map that will force players together before the end. While trying to eliminate their enemies and avoid death, players will need to complete different objectives, including taking down a specific enemy, or some other task.
Processor: Intel i5 4th generation or AMD FX 6300 or equivalent

Title: Undawn
short_description: A free-to-play open-world survival RPG developed by LightSpeed studios and published by Level Infinite.
Description:
Undawn is a free-to-play open-world survival RPG developed by LightSpeed Studios and published by Level Infinite. Set four years after a global calamity, the game casts players in the role of survivors where they must face not only each other but hordes of infected. The game features PvE and PvP in a massive open-world map.

The game is built in Unreal Engine 4 to be as seamless as possible. Players will be able to explore diverse biomes where they will deal with a variety of extreme weather. They’ll also have to plan around things like hunger, hydration, and even their mood. Of course, environment affects these things. To survive they can trade resources with players, team up and rebuild the ruins of the world, and more. Just, don’t forget to protect what’s yours.

Title: Eden Eternal
short_description: A free to play fantasy MMORPG with cute anime-inspired graphics.
Description:
Eden Eternal is a free to play anime-style 3D MMORPG developed by X-Legend. Adventure towards the perfect land of Eden Eternal with your unique classes and along the way join a guild and start building towns with tons of customization options.

You were born from crystals and you are meant to lead your ravaged world to the land of Eden Eternal. Along the way you choose from multiple different classes that you can level up and if you start getting bored with one class just switch to another one and continue the leveling process. There are 20 different playable classes and 5 different races to choose from as you adventure through Eden Eternal.

If you are looking for a game with personal customization, then Eden Eternal has a few things for you. Purchase a house and upgrade various things inside of it, interior design, storage locations, ect. Then once you have a house and if you want even more customization join a guild. Guilds have access to entire towns that they can build with tons of different buildings to help you progress along your journey.

Title: Veiled Experts
short_description: A free-to-play multiplayer shooter game focused on the search and destroy mode of classic shooters.
Description:
Veiled Experts is a free-to-play multiplayer shooter game focused on the search-and-destroy mode of classic shooters. 

It combines newer gameplay – such as the shrinking map of battle royales with the classic mode to offer players a bit more. This means that it will be more difficult for players to camp each other and they’ll need to move around quite a bit. Luckily, the gameplay is vertical as well and players can navigate the world parkour-style.

Players can choose from a variety of unique players in order to find something that fits their playstyle. Based on the agent they choose, players can be support, full assault, do recon, snipe from far away, or just roll in for close-quarter combat. 

The game also features a changing landscape with buildings hit by bombs crumbling or ships sinking. This means players can eliminate things that might otherwise block their line of sight. That’s gonna make the whole hiding behind – or on – a wall thing that much more difficult.

Title: Jected - Rivals
short_description: A free-to-play game mixing extreme sports with destructible vehicles and a unique ejection mechanic.
Description:
Jected – Rivals is a free-to-play game that mixes extreme sports, destructible vehicles, and speed in 18-player matches. To survive in this game, players will need to make use of a special ejection mechanic that will allow them to launch themselves out of their vehicles and into the sky. The trick is learning how to optimize this mechanic and get the lead on everyone else.

Players have a variety of vehicles to choose from – finding the one that best fits their playstyle. Choices range from supercars to SUVs, and more. And each can be tailored to the player’s preferences.

The jetwing mechanic allows players to free themselves from the confines of their vehicle and easily move over or around obstacles. It can even be paired with a selection of gadgets like a grappling hook.

Title: Ethyrial: Echoes of Yore
short_description: A old-school MMORPG set in a world on the brink of Civil War
Description:
Ethyrial: Echoes of Yore is an old-school, hardcore MMORPG set in a world on the brink of civil war. Nobles have wrested control from an imperial council and now fight for power and cults work to implement their own plans for the world. Add to that the creatures that pose a threat and you can see the world of Irumesa is a dangerous place.

Ethyrial allows players to build a character using an expansive character and class system. They’ll need to do their best with the build and be willing to work with others because if they die, they’re permanently dead.

The game features a large world to explore, filled with treasure and secrets. In addition, it has room for players to claim property and build whatever they desire. Learn crafting, explore the game’s ongoing story, and more.
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070, 8GB or AMD Radeon RX 590, 8GB

Title: Warlander
short_description: A medieval-style combat game with a selection of modes and characters.
Description:
Warlander is a third-person multiplayer game that combines a Medival-style setting with fantasy items and abilities – and robots. The gameplay is made of skirmishes and castle siege warfare with as many as 100 players and features classes like Warriors, Clerics, and Mages. Players don’t only rely on their class powers in combat, however. They can also make use of siege weapons.

The game features two combat modes: 2 army and 5 army, and combines gameplay styles of MOBAs, battle royales, 3rd person hack-and-slash, ranged combat, and strategic diplomacy. Players either defend castles or take to the battlefield to fight the enemy, capture towers, and more. They’ll need to use both their siege weapons and spells well in order to win.

In addition to the many gameplay features, Warlander features a sizeable roster of class-based characters. Each has its own customizable equipment, skills, and even emotes.
Processor: Intel Core i5-7400 @3.00 GHz / AMD FX-600 Six-Core

Title: Stalcraft: X
short_description: A free-to-play MMOFPS set in an open-world.
Description:
Stalcraft: X is an open-world MMOFPS set in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone. The game combines PvP and PvE, with activities like artifact hunting, mutant slaying, quests, and faction wars. It also offers “session modes” for those who don’t have a lot of time to spend in the game.

Despite being an MMO, the game avoids the leveling mechanic associated with the genre in favor of players progressing by obtaining equipment. This can be done in a variety of ways, including purchasing it from other players. In fact, one thing Stalcraft: X does take from the MMO genre is the economy, which allows players to become merchants.

Stalcraft: X is free-to-play. Players can support the game either via a play-for-time system or by purchasing cosmetics. That said, all items can be obtained by playing the game. Cash purchases will just allow players to get things sooner.
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti / AMD Radeon RX 560 / Intel Arc A310

Title: Fangs
short_description: A 4v4 MOBA with hero-specific strategies.
Description:
Fangs is a 4v4 MOBA with a customizable experience developed and published by Hidden Leaf Games. Players can unlock and alternate hero-specific augments to make their hero their own. The game boasts a diverse cast of characters, both in background and style. The developer’s intention is for players to really find a hero that resonates with them.

The game’s customization system allows players to change augments for each round, assuring that their own personal style can complement that of their teammates. Augments offer players the chance to boost abilities – a little more healing here, a little more damage there.

Fangs is designed to be fast-paced, cutting out a lot of the stuff that causes other MOBA matches to drag out. It focuses on teamwork with the ultimate goal being that players feel like part of a community. The game is also intended to be friendly to new players and veterans and is described as “easy to learn and hard to master”.
Processor: Intel Core i5-4430 or AMD FX-6300
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 2GB or AMD Radeon R7 370 2GB

Title: Summoners War: Chronicles
short_description: A multi-platform ARPG set in the Summoners War universe.
Description:
Help the King of Rahil defend his kingdom against a massive conspiracy set in the Summoners War Universe. In Summoners War: Chronicles, players become a Rahil Guard and explore the world with a summoned companion. The ARPG offers players a look at what decision led to the world as seen in the original Summoners War game, Sky Arena. Players can choose to play one of three Summoners: Orbia, Kina, and Cleaf. They, along with their summoned companion will explore the continents and fight the darkness.

Each of the three summoners has its own unique role and skill set. These roles are enhanced by the ability to summon a team of monsters. And there are plenty to choose from – more than 350. Players will need to manage both their own combat and that of the monsters in real time in order to successfully explore the world.

Summoners War: Chronicles can be played on mobile devices and PC.

Title: Marvel Snap
short_description: A fast paced strategy card game set in the Marvel universe.
Description:
Take all your favorite Marvel heroes, give them super cute forms, put them in a strategic card battler game and you have Marvel Snap. As indicated by the name, the game is intended to be played in a snap – not the kind that Thanos used to eliminate half the world’s population, but the kind that means you can play a quick game anytime. In fact, any time you have three minutes or more to spare, you can get a game in.

Not only does the game feature many familiar faces from the Marvel universe, it also boasts more than 50 locations many fans will recognize. Each locale is more than just a change in appearance, they also change how the game is played, adjusting abilities. New locations will be introduced weekly, and players will need to flex their problem-solving skills in order to make the best of them.

The game is also designed for risk-takers. “Snap” doesn’t just mean the game is fast. It’s also a mechanic that allows players to raise the stakes of a match and potentially double their rewards.
Processor: Intel Core i5-650 or AMD Phenom II X4 965
Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 650 or AMD Radeon HD HD 6950

Title: World Boss
short_description: An experimental FPS based on io and roguelike gameplay.
Description:
Win the World Boss crown in Fresh and LazerBeam’s casual FPS, World Boss. This new shooter pits sixteen players against each other in a game inspired by io games and roguelikes. It’s intended to be a more accessible multiplayer shooter for everyone.

World Boss focuses on skill and experimentation. Game matches take place in semi-persistent lobbies. There, players will fight, level up, and make use of custom arsenals and perks in order to gain the upper hand and make it to the top of the leaderboard.

The game is designed with casual players in mind, skipping the queues and putting them directly into arenas, and streamlining combat to get players right into the action. Players can create their own builds by unlocking weapons and abilities each time they level up, even combining features from different weapons.
Processor: Intel Core i5-4430 / AMD Athalon Silver PRO 3125GE
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 2GB / AMD Radion R7 370 2GB

Title: Omega Strikers
short_description: A 3v3 socccer-style game with knockouts.
Description:
Grab two of your closest friends and team up in epic 3v3 soccer-style matches in Odyssey Interactive's Omega Strikers. The co-op PvP game pits two teams of three against each other in fast-paced matches where they both try to knock out their opponents and score goals soccer-style.

Similar to MOBAs and shooters, Omega Strikers features a growing roster of playable characters, including a well-armored hamster. Each character can be unlocked through gameplay and players have several play options to choose from. These include unranked, ranked, and private lobbies. The game also launched with a selection of maps. More maps and modes are planned for later release.

The game offers cosmetics and battle passes for monetization. There are no loot boxes or purchasable power boosts. The game will also feature seasons that will add new playable characters, stages, unlockables, and more.
Processor: Intel Core i5-4430 or AMD FX-6300
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960 or AMD Radeon R7 370

Title: Gundam Evolution
short_description: A 6v6 team-based shooter based on the Gundam multiverse
Description:
Embrace your love of shooter and all thing Gundam, because Bandai Namco's Gundam Evolution is here for you. Gundam fans everywhere get to live out their dreams of hopping into a Gundam suit and taking on the enemy in this 6v6 game featuring Units from across the different Gundam universes. Each suit has its own set of skills and abilities, as well as HP levels – because some are just beefier than others.

In addition to their unique stats, the Units all feature a Thrust system that allows them to cover long distances quickly and a Dash ability for an additional acceleration boost. They also offer players access to G-Maneuver effects. These are unique to each Unit and can be activated with the G-Maneuver Meter hits 100%.

Gundam Evolution is currently available for free on Steam. It boasts a very positive rating on the platform, so Gundam fans will want to give it a peek.

Title: Galahad 3093
short_description: A 12v12 team shooter featuring mechs based on Arthurian legend.
Description:
Mechs and Arthurian legend combine in Simultronics’ free-to-play team shooter Galahad 3093. The game features eight playable Knights and their mechs (known as Lances) each with its own unique weapons, deployable tech, and cosmetics. Team up with eleven other players and compete in 12v12 battle in two different game modes: Base Assault and Deathmatch. In Base Assault, teams work together to take down enemy generators, destroy their turrets, and capture spawn points all while defending their own base. Deathmatch focuses on the kills, although bases are capturable as well.

The Knights and Lances in Galahad 3093 are each inspired by different figures of Arthurian legend, including Aruther, Mordred, Morgan le Fay, and Owain. Each has abilities tied to the original myths – such as Arthur calling in the “X-Calibur orbital strike”.

Fight battles in several different battlefields – most of them not located in the UK. Maps include the frozen moon Europa, the sand worm-infested Bayesian Canyons, and SFG Heavy Industries. Customize your mechs using paint, holographic banners, and even nose art. Galahad 3093 is available for free via Steam.

Title: Aero Tales Online
short_description: Aero Tales Online: The World is a free-to-play 3D anime-style MMORPG with PvP and PvE elements. The game revolves around the “mysterious story of the Key of Skylight”.
Description:
Aero Tales Online: The World is a free-to-play 3D anime-style MMORPG with PvP and PvE elements. The game revolves around the “mysterious story of the Key of Skylight” – sending players on an adventure they’ll have to experience on their own. There’s not much in the way of details on the game’s story. Hence the “mysterious” part.

To explore the world, players will need to be ready to fight. The good news is, it’s up to them how they do it. Players can choose between action-combat mode or tab-target mode during combat. They may also vary their playstyle with different combo combinations. A special combat style exists for each class, along with special items. Of course, players will need to choose their faction before beginning to rumble.

In addition to general exploration, the game offers flight once players reach a certain level. It also features daily events, and plenty of social activities. These include house building, farming, and marriage, among other things.

Title: Magic Spellslingers
short_description: Magic Spellslingers is the latest entry based on Witzards of the Coast’s popular card game Magic: The Gathering.
Description:
Magic Spellslingers is the latest entry based on Witzards of the Coast’s popular card game Magic: The Gathering. Developed by Pipeworks Studios and Seismic Games, this card battler is intended to be an entry point into the Magic universe. Like other games of the same genre players will start out choosing a hero. In this case they choose from a selection fo Spellslingers, each offering unique abilities and strategies as well as cards to use in battle.

Not only is Magic Spellslingers a unique card game in its own right, it’s also intended to be an introduction to the Magic universe. Players can take on challenges designed for both first-time layers and experienced veterans anywhere they’re at. Even more, they have the option to create teams and share resources and decks with friends, and work together on strategies. Of course, teammates can compete against each other as well.

Title: A.V.A Global
short_description: A.V.A is a free-to-play online first-person shooter with multiple game modes, unique customizations, as well as PvP and PvE gameplay.
Description:
A.V.A is a free-to-play online first-person shooter with multiple game modes, unique customizations, as well as PvP and PvE gameplay.

If you are worried about running out of different game modes, customization and maps have no fear, in A.V.A there more than 14 maps, several game modes including Annihilation, Demolition and Breach! Plus the weapon attachment system allows you to modify your own weapons. Pick your favorite class and jump into the action!
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 9600 GT / ATI Radeon HD 4850 (512 MB)

Title: Lost Light
short_description: A post-apocalyptic shooter built around creating a realistic experience.
Description:
Shooter fans looking for a game built around creating a realistic experience will want to give NetEase Games’ Lost Light a look. Set in a post-apocalyptic environment, the game features lots of interesting places modeled to be like real-world locations to explore. It also boasts weapons intended to provide the most realistic experience possible. Each has up to 12 modifiable parts and hundreds of optional components. Despite the massive armory, the focus of Lost Light isn’t necessarily to run and gun. The game is survival, and that means making it to the evacuation point. If that means avoiding combat and just snagging loot along the way, that’s the way to go. Players can choose to go with a partner or to go it alone. But survival is often easier when you have someone to help you along.

Those who survive will be able to stash their loot and begin work on building a base of operations. That even means setting up a shop for trading with other players in the game. Lost Light is available on mobile devices and PC. The latter can be downloaded directly or via Steam. The game offers cross-platform features as well.

Title: Temperia: Soul of Majestic
short_description: Fans of collectible card games, are you looking for something a bit different from the normal fare? Then a peek at Moonwolf Entertainment and A2 Softworks’ Temperia: Soul of Majestic might be in order.
Description:
Fans of collectible card games, are you looking for something a bit different from the normal fare? Then a peek at Moonwolf Entertainment and A2 Softworks’ Temperia: Soul of Majestic might be in order. The strategy card game uses an open-handed game style where all cards are face up and combines two decks into one. The decks are made up of 20 Creature and 20 Equipment cards.

The game is designed to focus on player skill rather than the luck of the draw and takes inspiration from chess where everything is on display. Good players will be able to use this to their advantage when determining strategies. 

The game limits randomness and its impact on the game. Time and again, players will need to prove their skills in order to climb the leaderboard.

Title: MultiVersus
short_description: The Warner Bros lineup meets Smash in Player First Games’ MultiVersus.
Description:
The Warner Bros lineup meets Smash in Player First Games’ MultiVersus, a platform fighter featuring a wide range of characters from Warner’s movies, cartoons, and more. Fight Batman as Shaggy. Team up with Steven Universe and Finn. Make use of their unique abilities and take your opponents down.

The game features a large roster from popular media and shows as well as maps based on locations found there. That means players can visit the Batcave or Jake and Finn’s Treefort among other places. And they'll do it while taking par tin epic 1v1, 2v2, or 4 players free for all battles. 

There’s also a handy training mode where players can hone their skills. The game is available on all platforms and includes cross-platform play and progression.

Title: Chimeraland
short_description: Explore the open-world sandbox MMO game set in a mythical world. Play as one of a large number of races, from jelly-fish to dragon-person – or even a regular old human if that’s your thing. Explore the land, gather resources, craft items, build homes and more.
Description:
Monster, monsters everywhere. And so many of them the unholy combinations of many different monsters turned into one. That’s what you’re in for when you play Pixel Soft’s Chimeraland. That and a vast open world. Or is that universe? After all, you can travel to space and even build a base there.

Explore the open-world sandbox MMO game set in a mythical world. Play as one of a large number of races, from jelly-fish to dragon-person – or even a regular old human if that’s your thing. Explore the land, gather resources, craft items, build homes and more. And, while you’re doing that, fight a wide variety of monsters and hope to obtain an egg that will provide you with a smaller version of the creature in question, that you can raise and level up. You can also cross the creatures with each other and make all new creatures.

Explore the world with friends or alone. The game offers a high degree of freedom, so there’s plenty to do no matter how you chose to do it.

Title: World of Runes
short_description: An adorable anime-style MMO featuring cute pets and collectable cards.
Description:
World of Runes is an adorable anime-style MMO featuring cute pets. Players can choose between four different playable classes to explore the game’s world with. To help players get started, the game begins with a series of Novice Quests as an introduction to all the necessary systems. That includes the game’s controls. It also offers players a bit of a boost with more XP and rewards than regular quests.

The four available classes in the game are the Swordsman, Archer, Mage, and Cleric. Each features three abilities and is reliant upon each other in battle. The Swordsman fills both the physical melee and tank roles. Archer fills the physical long-range support and offers burst and high hit. Mage is your obvious magical DPS – both long-range and sustained. And Cleric is mostly support but with magical melee and sustained DPS.

Another feature of the game is the collectible cards, an MVP system that players can use to collect rare items. These include equipment, cards, and other items. These can be sold for Crystals in the game’s Exchange. Finally, players can collect pets to use in battle. Stats on pets vary depending on a few factors.

Title: Roller Champions
short_description: What if you could player roller derby, but in a more organized and less physically dangerous environment?
Description:
What if you could player roller derby, but in a more organized and less physically dangerous environment? What if it were basically Rocket League but on a track instead of a field, and wearing skates instead of driving a car. Well, if that’s what you’re looking for, Ubisoft’s latest offer, Roller Champions, is one you’ll want to check out.

A 3v3 competitive game, Roller Champions is played in third-person. It pits two teams against each other in matches where the goal is to be the first team to accumulate 5 points. The catch is that players only have seven minutes to accomplish this task. In order to do so they’ll need to have possession of the ball and skate a lap without interferrence from the other side. If that’s accomplished players can pass the ball off to other team mates who may complete even more laps. The more laps a team completes, the more points they’ll earn when they score a goal. Be careful deciding when to hit the goal, though, everything resets if the other side manages to interrupt.

Interrupting is pretty much what you probably think it is. If a team has the ball, it’s the job of the other side to tackle them or knock them over – pretty much whatever gains them possession of the ball. That said, these things can be dodged. So just be aware of your surroundings.

If you win matches, you’ll gain followers. More followers are accumulated every time a match is won. These allow teams to play in front of larger crowds. In addition, as with most games in this genre, players can customize their avatars’ gear. But, beyond that, they can customize their fans as well. That means players can look in the crowd and see just how many people are there for them.
Processor: AMD Ryzen 3 1200 @ 3.1 GHz, Intel Core i5-4460 @ 3.2 GHz
Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 560 (4 GB), Nvidia GeForce GTX 960 (4 GB)

Title: Goose, Goose, DUCK
short_description: A social deduction game with geese.
Description:
Goose, goose, DUCK is a social deduction game developed and published by Gaggle Studios, Inc. Slightly parodying the children’s game Duck, duck, goose; Goose, goose, DUCK puts players in the roles of geese trying to complete a mission. However, there are duck spies in their midst trying to stop them.

As with other social deduction games, it’s up to the geese to discover who the infiltrators are while managing to complete their mission. The ducks will do as all infiltrators do, including taking out the geese one at a time, in order to sabotage the mission.

Goose, goose, DUCK features public and private lobbies, built-in proximity voice chat, seven playable maps, five different modes, and a whole bunch of optional sub-roles. The game is available to play for free via Steam.

Title: Super Squad
short_description: Prepare yourself. It’s time for Mayhem. Super Squad is a multi-player online shoot-’em-up (or MOSH)!
Description:
Prepare yourself. It’s time for Mayhem. And you’ll get that from Bad Fox Studios’ Super Squad, a multi-player online shoot-’em-up (or MOSH). It combines the playstyle of MOBA’s with the tactics of RTSs.

The game features a wide roster of characters including soldiers, goat men, angels, vikings, pirates, dogs, and even something called a “Florp”. The characters fill basic team roles – damage, support, etc, so players will need to choose wisely in order to build the best team and destroy the competition. Also take into account the various combat styles of each character, and their preferred weapons. These abilities range from being able to burrow under enemies and blow them up with landmines to grappling  your way around the map and picking your foes off from a distance.

Battle your way across a military base. Fight on Mars. Or even take down a mothership. There are several maps to choose from, with more on the way.

Title: Sherwood Extreme
short_description: High action arcade shooter Sherwood Extreme sends players on a mission to save the kingdom!
Description:
Cage Studio’s high action arcade shooter Sherwood Extreme sends players on a mission to save the kingdom in the most extreme way possible. Parkour. Maneuver your way through battle. Flip off turrets, swing through trees, make your way up, over and around mountains, and do it all while destroying your enemies, swinging over them and popping off headshots – if you’re good enough, that is.

Sherwood Extreme is available to play in both single-player and co-op, with it becoming even more crazy when friends team up. Complete challenges together. Collect loot. Discover the secrets of Sherwood. And do it all in the most ridiculous way possible.

If crazy fun with your friends isn’t enough because you’re a bit more competitive, there’s a full leader board as well with a variety of challenges to take on. Test your speed and precision and parkour your way to the top.

Title: Smash Legends
short_description: Classic fairy tales get wild with 5minlab and LINE Games Corporation’s brawl-action game Smash Legends.
Description:
Classic fairy tales get wild with 5minlab and LINE Games Corporation’s combat action game Smash Legends. Take a trip to the Library World and play as one of several legends based on classic fairy tale characters like Peter Pan, Red Riding Hood, Puss in Boots, and even the Ugly Duckling.

While a more casual game, designed for cross-play on mobile devices and PC, Smash Legends includes a variety of modes ranging from 1v1 duel to a mini, 8-player battle royale mode. Other modes include a 3v3 area capture, 3v3 team deathmatch, a 4 player harvest mode, and more. The game also offers several maps to play on, all on an island floating above the clouds.

So, pick your favorite fairy tale character and beat up your friends in friendly, fun combat. The game will offer new modes in the future, so there will always be something fun to do.

Title: Primordials: Battle of Gods
short_description: Build armies and fight for control of the realm in Global Dodo Entertainment’s 1v1 strategy game Primordials: Battle of Gods.
Description:
Build armies and fight for control of the realm in Global Dodo Entertainment’s 1v1 strategy game Primordials: Battle of Gods. Take on the role of a Primordial and create an empire through conquest and the careful management of resources and building. While building their empire, playuers will need to not only upgrade buildings, but also champions and minions, in order to come out on top.
 
Some of these units have special abilities and ultimates that can only be brought out through careful upgrading. Upgrading minions and champions as well as buildings create more options regarding how players approach gameplay, giving them more ways to counter their opponent.  

The game features seven different Primordials for players to choose from. Each has its own lore and related special abilties, each affecting gameplay in a different way and making for a unique game. There are also eight champions, each with its own set of abilities. And, to round things out, three different realms, each with their own races that take on the role of minions.
Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 660 2GB / AMD Radeon R9 280 3GB

Title: Super Mecha Champions
short_description: Super Mecha Champions is a PC port of the mobile anime PvP game from NetEease, featuring a variety of modes but focusing on battle royale.
Description:
Super Mecha Champions is a PC port of the mobile anime PvP game from NetEease, featuring a variety of modes but focusing on battle royale. It also features a 5v5 deathmatch, duo battle, and more. Players take on the role of a mech pilot in Alpha City where they face pilots from all around the world for the chance to claim the title of top mech.

There are 10 mechs to choose from, all of which can be customized with skins and graffiti to make it unique. Stand out and make sure your opponents remember who took them out in a myriad of strategic battles. Take them on in everything from on the ground melee or aerial dogfights, by yourself or with friends. Make use of unlimited ammo and auto-aiming to do it, and get the most out of ion cannons, flamethrowers, and even exploding bot launchers.

Title: Chroma: Bloom And Blight
short_description: Competitive card game fans have a new, completely free option to add to their list.
Description:
Competitive card game fans have a new, completely free option to add to their list. Chroma: Bloom and Blight, from Clarity Games is a lore-focused card game designed for both experienced and new CCG players. 

The game offers players a sizeable collection of heroes to choose from before building their deck. Each of the heroes is tied to one of four factions – each represented by different colors, as are the rest of the cards. Since the game has a heavy focus on lore, that focus is worked into the gameplay system. Chroma matches are three-act stories, with progression in those acts introducing better ways for players to use their abilities. Of course, this requires players to  mange everything properly in order to tell a successful story.

Unlike other card games, Chroma does not charge players for card packs. Every card and game mode are available to players the minute they download the game and the developers promise this will always be the case. Instead, Clarity Games has monitized the game using cosmetics. This includes card art, loading screens, taunts, and more. And, as with most card games, players can also purchase a premium battle pass – with every reward on the pass being cosmetic as well.
Processor: Intel Core i5-2300, 2.8 GHz or equal equivalent
Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce™ GTX 660 or equal equivalent

Title: Blankos Block Party
short_description: What happens when you take the vinyl collectible toy experience and combine it with an open-world multiplayer game? You get Blankos Block Party!
Description:
What happens when you take the vinyl collectible toy experience and combine it with an open-world multiplayer game? You get Blankos Block Party, a free-to-play game that allows players to build their own block parties – which are like Mario Party-style activities – to share with their friends. Players can even participate in regular competitions held by the developer Mythical Games, for a chance to see their builds featured.

In addition to the block party builds, the game’s other focus is on the Blankos, vinyl-style “dolls” brought to life. Just like with real world vinyl dolls, these are collectible and can be bought and sold. Just like with real-world collectables, Blankos Block Party features limited edition vinyls, including some players can win or those that are available as part of seasonal events. The Blankos in question are designed by popular vinyl toy artists like Jon-Paul Kaiser, Tara McPherson, Kronk, and Dan Lish.
Processor: Intel Core i7-4770 or AMD FX 8310
Graphics: Nvidia GTX 660 or AMD Radeon HD 7870

Title: Slapshot: Rebound
short_description: Do you like hockey? How about physic-based multiplayer, arcade-style sports games with cute graphics? Well, this is the one for you.
Description:
Do you like hockey? How about physic-based multiplayer, arcade-style sports games with cute graphics? Well, this is the one for you. Oddshot Games’ Slapshot: Rebound offers players the ability to play matches of arcade-style hockey games, without the need of shoot buttons, puck glue, and RNG. Players must work together to keep control of the puck, passing, shooting, and (hopefully) scoring.  As with the original Slapshot, players control their characters using WASD and a mouse.

In fact, Rebound is very much like it’s predecessor, only with more features like training modes so players can work on their skills, leaderboards  – to show off the results of those sweet skills, and character customization. Make your character stand out using everything from hats and hair to gloves and glasses. You can even have a viking helmet if you really want.

Title: Rogue Company
short_description: From Hi-Rez Studios, the team that brought you Smite and Paladins, comes Rogue Company, a cross-platform, competitive team-based third person shooter.
Description:
From Hi-Rez Studios, the team that brought you Smite and Paladins, comes Rogue Company, a cross-platform, competitive team-based third person shooter. Available on PC, Xbox One, PlayStation4, and Nintendo Switch, Rogue Company features three different game modes, more than a dozen Rogues, and a wide selection of maps. The game offers players cross-play across all platforms and simultaneous content releases to assure everyone can play together easily. 

Rogue Company combines a variety of game-styles seen in several popular shooter games into a single game. Not only to Rogues engage in shooter combat with each boasting unique special abilities that allow them to control the map, but they also each feature specific melee abilities.

As with all Hi-Rez games, Rogue Company is developed with competitive esports play in mind. It also offers a similar store to those found in Smite and Paladins.

Title: Eternal Return: Black Survival
short_description: Combining elements from battle royale, MOBA, and the survival genres, Eternal Return: Black Survival is a game designed with a broad audience in mind.
Description:
Combining elements from battle royale, MOBA, and the survival genres, Eternal Return: Black Survival is a game designed with a broad audience in mind. The game takes place on a deserted island, where an organization known as AGLAIA is busy conducting shady experiments on humans in order to turn them into super humans. These test subjects are the game’s characters. 

Players compete in matches of up to 18 players, either in solo mode or with friends in the battle royale standard fight to be the last one standing. In addition to getting the combat basics down, players have other things to learn to make the best use of, such as being able to teleport across the map, or crafting important items. Crafting is very important in Eternal Return, allowing players to improve their gear and their chances of survival. 

The game also offers players flexibility, allowing them to create custom games for as many or as few people as they like. This feature is designed with esports in mind.
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 640, ATI Radeon HD 7700

Title: Blood of Steel
short_description: Blood of Steel is an online competitive strategy game featuring some of the most well-known figures throughout medieval history. Choose your general – a Crusader, Viking, Ninja or one of those from the Three Kingdoms. Build your kingdom and command armies in epic PvP battles using classic medieval warfare tactics.
Description:
Blood of Steel is an online competitive strategy game featuring some of the most well-known figures throughout medieval history. Choose your general – a Crusader, Viking, Ninja or one of those from the Three Kingdoms. Build your kingdom and command armies in epic PvP battles using classic medieval warfare tactics.  

This isn’t a solo endeavor. As players build their kingdoms, they’ll need to team up with friends in guilds to join a legion war,  siege castles, or even become King of the Hill. Whether players go at it alone or with a group, they’ll have plenty of opportunities to work their way to the top of the ranking board and earn the respect of their fellow players.

Play Blood of Steel for free via Steam or discover more about the game via developer/publisher YC Games’ website.
Processor: ntel Core i5 4-Core Processor and above
Graphics: NVIDIA Geforce GT 430 or AMD HD5550

Title: Spellbreak
short_description: Spellbreak is a multiplayer, multi-platform battle-royale where player take on the role of a “battlemage” mastering elemental magic and using spells to compete against other players.
Description:
Spellbreak is a multiplayer, multi-platform battle-royale where player take on the role of a “battlemage” mastering elemental magic and using spells to compete against other players. Players can choose between six different classes, Frostborn, Conduit, Pyromancer, Toxicologist, Stoneshaper, or Tempest. Each has a different playstyle that can be made even more unique with player customization – including creating different spell combinations.

The game features an ever-changing world known as Primdal with battles taking place in the Hollow Lands. Scattered throughout the map are hidden chests containing all kinds of useful equipment that will help during a fight. 

Spellbreak can be played on PC via the Epic Games Store, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. The game features cross-play and cross-progression, so players can play anywhere and bring their progress with them.

Title: Rocket League
short_description: Get your car-soccer gaming on for free with Psyonix’s Rocket League. The popular competitive multi-player game is a popular offering with over 57 million players.
Description:
Get your car-soccer gaming on for free with Psyonix’s Rocket League. The popular competitive multi-player game is a popular offering with over 57 million players. It includes both online casual and competitive modes as well as a fully-featured offline season mode. Players can also create custom matches using “Mutators” that allow them to change the rules, or play existing hockey and basketball-inspired modes.

The game offers a Rocket Pass option for serious players, which includes a 50%XP bonus and up to 70 special rewards like a new battle-car, keys, and more. There is also a challenge system that rewards players for participating in online matches and completing weekly challenges. Players can also purchase epsorts customization item in the Rocket League Esports Shop.
Os: Windows 7 (64 bit) or Newer (64 bit) Windows OS
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 760, AMD Radeon R7 270X, or better

Title: Armor Valor
short_description: Build your empire with the help of mythical heroes and well thought out strategy in R2 Games’ strategy RPG Armor Valor.
Description:
Build your empire with the help of mythical heroes and well thought out strategy in R2 Games’ strategy RPG Armor Valor. Set in the world of Norse mythology, players take on the role of the “Lord” building powerful armies, gathering resources and developing their castle – all while dealing with monsters and dragons tormenting the untamed landscape.

Armor Valor is set in the magical civilization of Brettchill in the southeast of Magmel. Once peaceful, this land is now filled with endless conflict. Elves and Dwarves have teamed up against humankind in an effort to put an end to this conflict, but humanity’s focus on technology and industry has prevented them from being stopped completely. As the human race spreads their influence, they come upon an even more powerful race – the Orcs – and make yet another enemy.

The game is available to play in three languages, English, Japanese, and Traditional Chinese. It features 21 different constructs divided into the following types: economy, city defense, military, and other. Not only do players need to defend their kingdom against NPC’s but they’ll have to contend with other players who may attack their kingdom at any time.

Title: Unfortunate Spacemen
short_description: Unfortunate Spacemen is a co-op multiplayer game about Shapeshifting with a Co-op Story Mode, lots of objectives and more!
Description:
Team up with friends and hunt space monsters. Or, head out on your own and fight the monsters yourself. Or, even, become the monster and hunt the space men. All of these options are yours when playing Geoff ‘Zag’ Keene and New Blood Interactive’s Unfortunate Spacemen. This co-op, multiplayer, solo game takes place in a failing space outpost where murder is the order of the day and everyone is suspect.

Featuring several different modes, Unfortunate Spacemen allows players to take on the role of a shapeshifter, or a spaceman. Players can compete against each other in matches of up to 16 players, work together in co-op story or survival mode, or take on those modes alone – fighting the Crumerian insect swarm or simply surviving waves of monsters. The game offers customization through a ranking system, proximity chat, and boths that help players learn the ropes.
Processor: 2.4 GHz Dual Core Processor or Higher

Title: Jade Goddess
short_description: Jade Goddess is a free-to-play, browser based MMO inspired by Eastern mythology.
Description:
As the name implies, Jade Goddess is a free-to-play, browser based MMO inspired by Eastern mythology. Players choose between four different classes: warrior, hunter, fury, and amazon and take up defencse of the Jade Dynasty. Play in a world filled with ancient Eastern lore on a quest to revive the Jade Goddess and bring an end to the chaos that controls the land.

The game offers players plenty of customization – equipment, powers, and more. It also provides plenty in the way of social activities. Take on commanding roles in your faction, earn titles, and even get married. Or, if the social end of things aren’t your thing, maybe you’ll want to check out the game’s PvP and PvE options, including the arena and dungeons.

If that’s not enough you can tame avatars and horses, uncover artifacts, and discover superweapons.

Title: Shop Titans
short_description: A free-to-play RPG shopkeeper simulation game where you are responsible for designing and maintaining your own shop.
Description:
Get ready to build your own fantasy retail empire in Kabam Games’ Shop Titans. By “fantasy” we mean actual fantasy. This isn’t just a retail simulator. Instead, you’ll be building your own one of a kind shop where you’ll sell much-needed items – such as weapons, gear, potions, and the like – to adventurers ready to take on the most dangerous dungeons and creatures in the land.

But you won’t just be selling them items either. In Shop Titans, you’re responsible for designing and maintaining your own shop, making it the best it can be. As for your stock, you won’t just be ordering it. Instead, you will hand-craft  your items, using material obtained by a crack crew of adventurers that you put together. Craft, upgrade, and enchant a variety of gear ranging from swords and shields to guns. Build your very own questing party from heroes in eighteen different classes. Equip them with the weapons you make and send them on their way to battle monsters and recover much needed crafting material. 

In addition to running your own shop and procuring the materials needed to keep it afloat, you’ll also want to do some networking. Join a guild and build a city. Work together on in-game events. And don’t forget to play the market.

Title: Survivor Legacy
short_description: Survivor Legacy is a free-to-play zombie-themed strategy game from R2 Games.
Description:
Survivor Legacy is a free-to-play zombie-themed strategy game from R2 Games. Set in the near future, the game takes place during a zombie infestation. The players are offworld when it happens, as part of a colonization mission known as “Pioneer”. Midway through their trip they receive a distress signal informing them that humanity has fallen to the outbreak forcing the player to return home in order to save what’s left of mankind and rebuild human civilation.

Hunt down the zombies and kill them to earn xp. Zombie slaying will also help players speed up the build on items such as lumber mills, mines, and the like needed to acquire the resources to rebuild their home town. Players can also join guilds and receive various boosts that will help their progression in game. All rewards improve as the levels of the zombies being killed or the player’s guild go up.

Recruit heroes – choosing between 26 different ones with unique characteristics and skills. Join in alliance battles and earn the title of “World Guardian” as well as the ability to decide how best to save humanity.

Title: Bombergrounds: Battle Royale
short_description: A free-to-play massively multiplayer battle Royale game inspired by the old-shool Bomberman games!
Description:
Bombergrounds: Battle Royale is a free-to-play multiplayer Battle Royale game inspired by old-shool Bomberman games. Players compete against each other playing as animals in island matches in an adorable but violent world where only one animal will be left standing. Matches are smaller than other battle royale games, consisting of 25 people or less. However, the battle royale themes are still there, with players competing on a large map that shrinks over time.

The combat in Bomberground is chaotic and fast-paced, requiring players to place bombs, gather power-ups, and even face each other one on one in melee combat using bats. The bats are useful in other ways as well, allowing players to punt bombs at their enemies from a distance. 

The game offers plenty several social features – including a friends list and chat – and allows players to team up with their friends to assure they’re together on a map. There is also cross-platform support for mobile and PC players, and controller support for those who need it. And yes, characters can be customized – including their weapons.

Title: Kakale Online
short_description: A free-to-play top-down 2D MMORPG from developer and publisher ViVa Games.
Description:
Enter the world of Kakele Online, a free-to-play top-down 2D MMORPG from developer and publisher ViVa Games. Available both on Steam and mobile devices, Kakele is completely free, with no pay-to-win options and no ads.

The game is designed for nostalgia seekers as a real-time 2D pixel game. It features regular updates, with drops every month or two. Players can customize their character’s outfits, build their own homes, and more.

The game features plenty for players to do as groups with a persistent game world offering open PvP and optional PvP modes, guilds, over 200 quests, and a world market among other things. Players can explore dungeons together and take on more than 20 bosses and 100 different monsters.

Title: Darwin Project
short_description: A free-to-play 10-player battle royale game set just prior to an impeding ice age.
Description:
Darwin Project is a free-to-play 10-player battle royale game set just prior to an impeding ice age. Players take on the roles of contestants in a dark reality show where they must not only survive the cold but each other.

As the game is both a manhunt and survival scenario. Players will need to take down their opponents. One player will actually take on the role of “Show Director”, the host of the show in control of everything from nukes to gravity storms. In addition, the game is open to spectator participation. Stream viewers can bet on competitors, and help the Show Director choose targets. So, everyone can be involved.

Title: Legends of Runeterra
short_description: A free-to-play CCG based on Riot Games' MOBA League of Legends.
Description:
Legends of Runeterra is a free-to-play CCG based on Riot Games’ MOBA League of Legends. Choose from a selection of LoL champions to build your deck around. Cards can b earned in-game or purchased directly from the store.

A unique feature of Legends of Runeterra is that it pulls from Leauge of Legends’ lore to create mechanics. Runeterra pulls geographic regions from LoL, each with its own mechanics. These regions can be combined to create unique play situations.

The game is available to play on PC and mobile devices.

Title: CRSED: F.O.A.D.
short_description: Take the battle royale genre and add  mystical powers and you have CRSED: F.O.A.D. (Aka Cuisine Royale: Second Edition)
Description:
Darkflow Software’s Cuisine Royale has been reincarnated as the “brutal MMO last-man-standing shooter”, CRSED: F.O.A.D (Cuisine Royale Second Edition) This game replaces the original and is focused on massive PvP battles filled with dozens of players fighting for supremacy in one of four highly detailed locations. Of course, this is a battle royale, so in addition to dealing with each other, players must contend with the ever-shrinking map.

Players can choose between seven different champions, each with a unique super power. Speaking of powers, there’s also a bit of mysticism involved, with ancient ritual, hex bags, blood magic, and more. Players can use these skills to flood the map, summon zombies, and even teleport.

Of course, it’s not all magick and powers. There are the standard weapons – all realistically modeled.These include anti-material guns, sniper rifles, Ars, rocket launchers and flamethrowers. Vehicles also have an impact on gameplay with players having access to military amphibians and speed boats.

Unlike other battle royales, CRSED: F.O.A.D offers players a choice between third and first-person view when playing. This is achieved by equipping all players with a familiar with a camera that can see players peeking around a corner. 

Previously described as an “all-kitchen-warfare battle royale game”, Cusine Royale started out as an April Fool’s joke from the developers of the MMO shooter Enlisted, and eventually took on a life of its own due to how popular it was with fans. But the new season and reboot, changes everything!
Graphics: Nvidia GeForce 560 or better, AMD Radeon 77XX or better

Title: Mirage Online Classic
short_description: A browser-based free-to-play spiritual successor to 2001's Mirage Online.
Description:
Mirage Online Classic offers players quite a bit to delve into – all in an old-school 16-bit package. Available to play both via browser or Steam, the game features six classes with 30 subclasses. There are also more than 20 dungeons and a wide variety of places to explore. The world is also constantly expanding as the developers respond to player feedback.

Mirage Online Classic is the spiritual successor of the 2001 2D MMORPG, Mirage Online. The original launched as an open-source game and has had quite a few fan projects developed around that. The original developer, Retrelon Games began work on a new project in 2017 that would eventually become the HTML5-based MMORPG available today.

Title: Inferna
short_description: A cross-platform MMO from indie developer and publisher Inferna Limited, designed for players seeking a classic experience.
Description:
Inferna is a cross-platform MMO from indie developer and publisher Inferna Limited, designed for players seeking a classic experience. Explore the world of Pangaeu as one of four character classes including Magician, Warrior, Semi-Demon, and Assassin.

Choose to ally yourself with one of two kingdoms: Caratas or Serro. Explore the world of Pangeau via quests that provide information on the world’s history and culture. The game puts an emphasis on player chouse with decisions affecting the course of the narrative.

Quests range from helping solve quarrels between families to exploring dungeons and new realms — in addition to protecting the kingdom you’ve chosen to ally yourself with. So, there’s always something to do.

Title: Ultimate Pirates
short_description: A browser-based strategy MMO published for both desktop and mobile browsers by Gameforge.
Description:
Ultimate Pirates is a browser-based strategy MMO published for both desktop and mobile browsers by Gameforge. Developed by Moonmana and Grafit — who are known for their contributions to Bethesda and CD Projekt Red games — Ultimate Pirates features both PvE and PvP that will appeal to the pirate lovers among us.

Sail the oceans, explore Caribbean islands and plunder all the treasure you can. Team up with other players or fight them and take all their loot — not just their treasure, but weapons.
